text:
*[Bug 16738] file.show() cannot handle null bytes (in UTF-16)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16738>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED

--- Comment #1 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Thanks, I confirm this is a bug. Not only with UTF-16 input as shown here, but
in general the original code is incorrect for input in any encoding other than
the current native encoding (today typically UTF-8). One could specify the
input encoding with the connection, but reading as raw bytes and then running
iconv is closer to the original code wrt to handling invalid bytes. Fixed in
R-devel by your patch.

elements.text: [Bug 16738] file.show() cannot handle null bytes (in UTF-16)

) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED

--- Comment #1 from Tomas Kalibera (

) ---
Thanks, I confirm this is a bug. Not only with UTF-16 input as shown here, but
in general the original code is incorrect for input in any encoding other than
the current native encoding (today typically UTF-8). One could specify the
input encoding with the connection, but reading as raw bytes and then running
iconv is closer to the original code wrt to handling invalid bytes. Fixed in
R-devel by your patch.

text:
*[Bug 16714] na.omit and other na.actions incurs a copy even if no change*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16714>

Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|NEW                         |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Tomas Kalibera (<mailto:tomas.kalibera@gmail.com|tomas.kalibera@gmail.com>) ---
Now fixed in R-devel (na.omit.data.frame and na.exclude.data.frame, 88495): the
copy is avoided. I left the condition "any(omit > 0L)" in the code - it is used
also at some other places and I read it was a performance optimization (43271).

elements.text: [Bug 16714] na.omit and other na.actions incurs a copy even if no change

) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |tomas.kalibera@gmail.com
         Resolution|---                         |FIXED
             Status|NEW                         |CLOSED

--- Comment #2 from Tomas Kalibera (

) ---
Now fixed in R-devel (na.omit.data.frame and na.exclude.data.frame, 88495): the
copy is avoided. I left the condition "any(omit > 0L)" in the code - it is used
also at some other places and I read it was a performance optimization (43271).

*[Bug 18911] cleanup tcltk*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18911>

--- Comment #3 from Eric Lindblad (<mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>) ---
Hopfully this is not deemed off-topic; feasibly R's use of Tcl/Tk might be
revisited somedsy.


Some issues with Audio and Video quality, but Posting this as the content
indicates it is an impressive project.

Bologna, Italy
July 10, 20205

`<https://learn.wu.ac.at/eurotcl2025/lecturecasts/753988238?m=delivery>`
The future of BWidget in context of Tk and ttk (Thomas Wunderlich)

`<https://openacs.km.at/evaluate/org/129998253/conferencenews/>`
